Key Match Events: Phil Salt scored 87 not out, the highest innings by an England player in the match.
Jonny Bairstow contributed 48 not out, supporting Salt's innings.
West Indies collapsed from 143-4 to 180-4 in the last three overs, losing key players like Rovman Powell and Andre Russell.
England's bowlers, led by Adil Rashid and Moeen Ali, performed well to restrict West Indies' scoring.
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and elected to bowl first.
West Indies made changes to their lineup, including bringing back Romario Shepherd.
England's team included returning players Mark Wood and Liam Livingstone.
The match was played at the Daren Sammy National Stadium in St Lucia.
Post-Match Reflections: Adil Rashid praised England's bowling performance, particularly his own and Moeen Ali's contributions.
Jos Buttler, England's captain, highlighted the team's ability to control the game after the West Indies' collapse.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was significant as it was the first of the Super Eights round in the World Cup.
The venue, Gros Islet, is known for its favorable batting conditions.
The match was a high-scoring encounter, with England and West Indies both showcasing powerful batting performances.
